p: The total bilirubin and direct bilirubin levels ( p < 0.05) showed a significantly increase in the toxic rat-induced paracetamol group, as shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2. The administration of P. odoratissimus extract with a dose of 300, 600 and 900 mg/kg and silymarin 200 mg/kg can inhibit the increase of paracetamol intoxication. The levels of total bilirubin and direct bilirubin in the rat groups treated with extract and silymarin were significantly different ( p < 0.05) from the hepatotoxic rat group. Moreover, the total bilirubin and direct bilirubin levels of rat groups treated with P. odoratissimus extract in doses of 600 and 900 mg/kg were not significantly different compared to the healthy rat group ( p > 0.05).
